channel.title: [PI] Need to make an object (chest) give 1 item to a player, once
channel.description: Like the title says. I need to make a chest give a player an item. The player can not open it more then once.

item.title: [PI] Need to make an object (chest) give 1 item to a player, once
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:3, topic:536769”]Why are you even showing him to use an integer. Your showing him bad habits.

You always use booleans for this.[/quote]
Moparscape
Where my preferred way of programming is clearly better than yours!

Seriously, whatever way the dude is most comfortable with should do just fine, if server optimization is ever needed then it should be done, but I don’t see the need of going out of your way just because of that.

Just a rant, I suppose.

Read full topic

Why are you even showing him to use an integer. Your showing him bad habits.

You always use booleans for this.
[/quote]
actually int uses 4 bytes.
boolean uses 4 bytes.
byte uses 1 byte…
byte is the best option ~_~’[/quote]

no, you use booleans for this.

item.source: [PI] Need to make an object (chest) give 1 item to a player, once

item.title: [PI] Need to make an object (chest) give 1 item to a player, once
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Another thing you could do, since it’s a dynamic world object (meaning it gets sent to the client via the server), add some code so that the chest is only shown to players who haven’t opened it yet.

public class Player {

    // ...

    public boolean hasOpenedBeginnerChest() {
        return openedBeginnerChest;
    }

    private boolean openedBeginnerChest;
}
if (!player.hasOpenedBeginnerChest()) {
    player.getClientContext().createObject(chest, location);
}

Or, if the default behavior is for the chest to always be there, until you open it (which I’m assuming is what you’re looking for), you can just add a visibility filter, based on whether the player has opened it or not.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Need to make an object (chest) give 1 item to a player, once
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“Mr…x…, post:1, topic:536769”]Like the title says. I need to make a chest give a player an item.
The player can not open it more then once.[/quote]

Make a new object case and add something like this in it.

case 555: If(chestReceived == false || chestReceived == 0) { //You'll have to make an int or boolean for this. And set it to 1 if the object is used. Pick one of the options don't use them both. addItem(ItemId); ChestReceived = true; } break;

Read full topic
